00002  *  maven Programming Language

00006 #include "maven.h"
00007 #include "struct_StringList.h"
00008 #include "struct_MavenCompiler.h"
00009 #include "struct_MavenObject.h"
00010 #include "strings.h"
00011 #include "errors.h"
00012 #include "objects.h"
00013 
00014 using namespace std;
00015 
00016 string keywordCatch(MavenCompiler* c, string line, MavenVariable& catchVar) {
00017         // strip out the catch
00018         string newCatch = line.substr(line.find('(') + 1, line.length() - line.find('(') - 2);
00019         
00020         // this can only be 2 words
00021         StringList words = split(' ', newCatch);
00022         if(words.length() != 2) {
00023                 pushError(c, "Expecting two words in catch");
00024                 return MAVEN_INVALID;
00025         }
00026         
00027         // make sure the first word is the name of a class
00028         // bug #26: and its extended from maven.Exception
00029         int namespaceID, objectID;
00030         findClass(c, words[0], namespaceID, objectID);
00031         if(namespaceID < 0 || objectID < 0) {
00032                 pushError(c, "Unknown exception class %s", words[0]);
00033                 return MAVEN_INVALID;
00034         }
00035         
00036         // make catchVar
00037         catchVar.name = words[1];
00038         catchVar.type = c->namespaces->at(namespaceID).name + "." + c->namespaces->at(namespaceID).objects->at(objectID)->name;
00039         
00040         // build C++ version of catch
00041         newCatch = c->namespaces->at(namespaceID).name + "::" + c->namespaces->at(namespaceID).objects->at(objectID)->name + "* " + words[1];
00042         return "catch(" + newCatch + ")";
00043 }
